children.name: Volkswagen
children.example1:
Schreib aus diesen Informationen einen Zeitungsartikel für eine Tageszeitung, aufgehängt daran, dass Volkwagen fünf Milliarden bei Rivian investiert

Volkswagen holt sich bei Elektroautos Hilfe vom Tesla-Herausforderer Rivian - und nimmt dafür Milliarden in die Hand. Europas größter Autobauer will bis zu 5 Milliarden Dollar (4,7 Mrd. Euro) ausgeben und gemeinsam Technik für künftige Fahrzeuge entwickeln. Für Rivian ist es eine höchst willkommene Geldspritze: Die Firma schreibt nach wie vor rote Zahlen und hat aktuell mit einem sinkenden Interesse an Elektroautos in den USA zu kämpfen.
Die zuletzt schwächelnde Rivian-Aktie sprang im nachbörslichen US-Handel um fast 50 Prozent hoch.
Die Kooperation ist recht eng gefasst: Software, Steuercomputer sowie Netzwerk-Architektur. Ein zentraler Punkt: Volkswagen wird für neue Autos in der zweiten Hälfte des Jahrzehnts auf Rivians Technologie und Software einschwenken. Der Autoriese könnte damit viel Geld im Vergleich zu einer Entwicklung der Technik in Eigenregie sparen. Rivian-Chef RJ Scaringe betonte in einer Telefonkonferenz am Dienstag, dass andere Bereiche wie Batterien oder Antriebstechnik nicht Teil der Partnerschaft seien.
Damit die Hersteller immer neue Funktionen bieten können, sammelten sich in Autos schon seit Jahren mehr und mehr Steuereinheiten und längere Kabelstränge an. Mit dem Vormarsch von Elektroautos kam auch ein Wettstreit bei neuen Fahrzeug-Architekturen in Gang. Die Trends: Weniger Komplexität und ein Fokus auf Software. Tesla war ein Vorreiter - ein Computer auf Rädern.
Rivian entwickelte von Anfang an eine eigene Architektur, in der die Auto-Elektronik in mehrere Zonen mit eigenen Computern aufgeteilt wird. In der ersten Generation der Rivian-Plattform seien noch 17 dieser Steuereinheiten nötig gewesen, sagte Scaringe. Jetzt zur zweiten Generation habe man die Zahl auf sieben gedrückt.
VW hat seit Jahren mit Problemen bei der hauseigenen Software-Entwicklung für Elektroautos zu kämpfen, dadurch verzögerten sich bereits Modellstarts. Scaringe legte am Dienstag den Finger in die Wunde. Man habe in den vergangenen Jahren erkannt, dass etablierte Hersteller Schwierigkeiten bei eigener Software hätten.
Er sieht den Grund dafür darin, wie das Geschäft der Autobauer über Jahrzehnte lief: Viel Technik wurde bei verschiedenen Zulieferern eingekauft, "im Ergebnis hatte man eine Menge kleiner Computer, die an ganz bestimmte Funktionen angebunden waren". Wenn man aus dieser Welt komme, tue man sich schwer damit, eine Architektur nach dem Zonen-Prinzip zu entwickeln, bei der eine Steuereinheit Funktionen über mehrere Bereiche hinweg übernehme. Rivian ordnete diese ECU (Electronic Control Unit) verteilt im Fahrzeug an, um den Weg für die Datenübermittlung zu verkürzen.
Rivian sei einer der weniger Hersteller, die eine solche Zonen-Architektur in der Serienproduktion hätten - und damit wertvoll für VW, kommentierte den Deal der Autoanalyst der Marktforschungsfirma Garter, Pedro Pacheco. Wenn man bedenkt, wie viel Geld Volkswagen bereits in die Entwicklung einer eigenen Plattform investiert habe, seien die Milliarden für Rivian "ein echtes Schnäppchen" für den deutschen Konzern. Der Deal sende auch ein Signal, dass Dinge, die man einst selber entwickelte, nun von einem anderen Hersteller kommen könnten. Zugleich warf Pacheco die Frage auf, was Hersteller mit ihren eigenen Autosoftware-Teams machen, wenn sie so viel zukaufen.
Der Plan von Rivian und VW sieht ein Gemeinschaftsunternehmen vor, in dem für beide Hersteller entwickelt werden soll. Die Milliarden sollen Rivian nach und nach zufließen. Erst kauft VW Wandelanleihen für eine Milliarde Dollar. Kommt das gemeinsame Entwicklungslabor zustande, zahlt VW eine weitere Milliarde, kauft in zwei Tranchen Aktien für jeweils eine Milliarde 2025 und 2026 und gibt eine weitere Milliarde als Kredit.
Volkswagen bekam zuletzt mehr und mehr Schwierigkeiten beim offensiven Kurs in Richtung Elektromobilität. In Europa ist die Nachfrage schwach, in China ist der Wettbewerb mit günstigen heimischen Herstellern hart. In den USA will der Konzern mit Elektroautos deutlich Marktanteile gewinnen und hatte dafür hohe Investitionen bereits angekündigt.
Rivian lieferte im vergangenen Quartal knapp 13.600 Elektroautos aus und machte dabei 1,2 Mrd. Dollar Umsatz sowie 1,45 Mrd. Dollar Verlust. Die Firma ist in zwei in den USA populären Fahrzeug-Kategorien aktiv: Große SUV und Pick-ups. Außerdem baut Rivian für Amazon elektrische Lieferwagen, die inzwischen auch in Europa zu sehen sind. Der weltgrößte Online-Händler ist ebenfalls ein Investor.
Die Stimmung unter den Tesla-Herausforderern, die sich ein immer schnelleres Tempo beim Elektroauto-Absatz erhofften, ist verhalten. Gerade in den USA greifen viele Käufer aktuell lieber zu Hybrid-Modellen, auch bei Tesla ist das Wachstum plötzlich gebremst. Die Firma Fisker, die in Graz bei Magna fertigen ließ, musste einen Insolvenzantrag stellen. Ihr SUV-Modell Ocean kam mit Verzögerungen auf den Markt und verärgerte einige Käufer und Tester mit Software-Problemen.


SAN FRANCISCO, June 25 (Reuters) - German automaker Volkswagen Group (VOWG_p.DE), opens new tab will invest up to $5 billion in U.S. electric-vehicle maker Rivian (RIVN.O), opens new tab as part of a new, equally controlled joint venture to share EV architecture and software, the companies said on Tuesday.
Shares of Rivian surged about 50% in extended trade after the announcement, potentially supercharging the company's market value by nearly $6 billion, if gains hold on Wednesday.
The auto industry faces a crucial time as EV startups grapple with a slowdown in demand amid high interest rates and dwindling cash, while traditional automakers struggle to build battery-powered vehicles and advanced software.
The investment will provide Rivian the funding necessary to develop its less expensive and smaller R2 SUVs that are set to roll out in early 2026 and its planned R3 crossovers, CEO RJ Scaringe told Reuters. Moreover, the partnership will enable Rivian to cut operating costs by leveraging volumes of supplies including chips and components, he said.
It will also help Rivian, known for its flagship R1S SUVs and R1T pickups, turn cashflow positive. The company will license its existing intellectual property to the JV, and the R2 will be the first vehicle using software from the JV. Volkswagen vehicles, including its Audi, Porsche, Lamborghini and Bentley brands, will follow.
"Any cash infusion like that is huge. Getting the support of Volkswagen Group certainly really strengthens their story toward Europe and toward Asia eventually," said Vitaly Golomb, managing partner at Mavka Capital, a Rivian investor.
For Volkswagen, analysts and investors see the investment as a move to solve the company's software struggles. VW's software division, Cariad - set up under former VW Group CEO Herbert Diess - has exceeded its budget and failed to meet goals. That contributed to Diess' exit in September 2022.
Volkswagen will immediately invest $1 billion in Rivian through a note that will convert to stock on Dec. 1, subject to regulatory approvals. Volkswagen will also make a $1 billion payment at the inception of the JV, expected in the fourth quarter of this year.
The German automaker will also invest $2 billion in Rivian stock - $1 billion each in 2025 and 2026 - subject to the startup hitting certain milestones, and provide a $1 billion loan in 2026.
Even with losses of nearly $40,000 for every vehicle it delivers, Rivian has been on a steadier footing than other EV startups that have been forced to slash prices or file for bankruptcy, including Fisker earlier this month.
To keep its head above water, Rivian has been slashing costs even as it works to deliver its EVs on time. It has also been renegotiating supplier contracts and building some parts in-house.
The company has overhauled its manufacturing process, which has led to a significant reduction in cost of materials, Scaringe told Reuters last week.
Rivian's cash and short-term investments fell by about $1.5 billion in the first quarter to just under $8 billion. Before the VW deal, Rivian had said it had enough capital to launch the R2 SUVs.
"They were definitely going to need something to get them past the launch of the R2s. This definitely helps extend that range," said Sam Fiorani, vice president at research firm AutoForecast Solutions.
Rivian stock has halved so far this year. Traders have bet heavily that the stock will fall, with an equivalent of 18% of its shares recently sold short, according to data from S3 Partners.
Volkswagen said earlier this year it was sticking with plans to launch 25 EV models in North America across its group brands by 2030, even as it acknowledged slowing growth in the segment. The company's shares are down around 3% so far this year.
Mavka Capital's Golomb said VW is not a big player in the large SUV and pickup segments in the U.S. and it has failed to break through with its crossover electric SUV ID4. But the partnership with Rivian gives the company options, he said.
Volkswagen said on Tuesday the Rivian software will also be used by the German carmaker's off-road EV brand Scout, which is building a plant in South Carolina to assemble pickups and SUVs that would compete with Rivian. The plant is scheduled to open in late 2026.
VW's Cariad has been struggling for years. Analysts say parts of its legacy system come from suppliers, which makes integrating all the different pieces complicated. Problems at the unit delayed work on important new vehicle models Porsche e-Macan and Audi Q6 e-tron.
Volkswagen has launched a new software architecture but cars made using that technology will only hit the market in 2028.
Still, VW said Cariad will play a central role in scaling up software that is used across the brands.


Volkswagen investiert fünf Milliarden Dollar in das US-Startup Rivian. Außerdem planen die frischgebackenen Partner ein paritätisch kontrolliertes Joint Venture zur gemeinsamen Nutzung von Elektroauto-Architektur und Elektroauto-Software.
Rivian kann mit der Kapitalspritze von VW die geplanten günstigeren Modelle R2 und R3 fertig entwickeln: Der R2 soll Anfang 2026 auf den Markt kommen, der R3 soll folgen. Zudem werde Rivian von geringeren Kosten für Chips und andere Komponenten profitieren, so Rivian-Chef RJ Scaringe (im Titelbild rechts neben VW-Boss Oliver Blume). Offenbar sollen diese Teile gemeinsam eingekauft werden, womit sich höhere Mengen und damit niedrigere Preise ergeben.
 
VW profitiert von Rivians Patenten, die an das Joint Venture lizenziert werden. Der R2 soll das erste Fahrzeug sein, das Software von dem Gemeinschaftsunternehmen nutzt. Volkswagen-Fahrzeuge sollen folgen, darunter auch Autos von den Konzernmarken Audi, Porsche, Lamborghini und Bentley.
Die Investition soll offenbar die Softwareprobleme des VW-Konzerns beheben helfen. Die Softwaresparte Cariad erreichte in den letzten Jahren ihre Ziele nicht, was ein Grund für den Abgang von Konzernchef Herbert Diess im Herbst 2022 gewesen sein soll. Zudem führten die Probleme zur Verschiebung des Markstarts für die PPE-Fahrzeuge Porsche Macan Electric und Audi Q6 e-tron um etwa ein Jahr.
Die fünf Milliarden investiert VW nicht auf einen Schlag, wie Reuters berichtet. Nur eine Milliarde soll sofort fließen, im vierten Quartal eine weitere Milliarde und 2025 und 2026 dann jeweils eine weitere Milliarde. Die fünfte Milliarde soll 2026 in Form eines Darlehens gewährt werden. 
Rivian macht laut Reuters fast 40.000 Dollar Verlust mit jedem ausgelieferten Fahrzeug – auf dem Markt sind derzeit der R1T und der R1S, außerdem der Lieferwagen EDV. Doch durch drastische Kostensenkungen in Produktion und Einkauf sowie pünktliche Auslieferungen steht das 2019 gegründete Unternehmen besser da als manch anderes Startup. So verfügte das Unternehmen schon vor dem VW-Deal über knapp acht Milliarden Dollar in bar. Der Börsenkurs sank jedoch von rund 27 Dollar im letzten Sommer auf unter 10 Dollar im April. Nach Bekanntgabe der VW-Investition stieg er um rund 20 Prozent auf 12 Dollar. 
Trotz der Nachfrageschwäche bei Elektroautos hält der VW-Konzern an seinem Plan fest, bis 2030 in Nordamerika 25 Elektromodelle auf den Markt zu bringen. Dazu gehören auch die geplanten Pick-ups und SUVs der neuen Marke Scout. Diese werden von Magna entwickelt. sollen aber von VW selbst in einem neuen Werk in South Carolina produziert werden. Marktstart soll 2027 sein. Die Software werde vom neuen Joint Venture kommen, schreibt Reuters unter Berufung auf VW. 
Nachdem der Start der PPE-Modelle von Porsche und Audi wegen der Software deutlich verschoben werden musste, will VW die Scout-Modelle rechtzeitig auf den US-Markt bringen. Dabei soll offenbar die Software von Rivian helfen. Dafür investiert der Konzern nicht weniger als fünf Milliarden Dollar bis 2026.  

Volkswagen, the German automaker, said on Tuesday that it would invest up to $5 billion in Rivian, a maker of electric trucks that has struggled to turn a profit, and that the companies would cooperate on software for electric vehicles.
The deal creates an unusual alliance between the world’s second-largest carmaker and an electric vehicle start-up that has strained to live up to investors’ expectations that it would achieve the kind of success that made Tesla the world’s most valuable automaker.
If successful, the partnership would address weaknesses at both companies. It would provide Volkswagen with the software expertise that auto analysts say it sorely lacks. And Rivian, in addition to cash, would benefit from the manufacturing expertise of an automaker that produces nearly 10 million vehicles a year, putting it just behind Toyota Motor in the global auto industry.
Volkswagen said it would initially invest $1 billion in Rivian, and over time increase that to as much as $5 billion. If regulators approve the transaction, Volkswagen could become a significant shareholder. The infusion represents a big vote of confidence in Rivian, which loses tens of thousands of dollars on each vehicle it sells.
Rivian's pickups and sport utility vehicles have received glowing reviews in the automotive press, but the company has struggled to ramp up manufacturing at its factory in Normal, Ill. In recent months, many investors have grown worried that the company may not survive long enough to become profitable.
R.J. Scaringe, Rivian’s founder and chief executive, said the cash from Volkswagen would help Rivian launch a midsize S.U.V. called the R2 that will sell for about $45,000, and to complete a factory in Georgia. Rivian halted construction of the Georgia plant in March in an effort to save more than $2 billion.
“This is important for us financially,” Mr. Scaringe said of the Volkswagen partnership on a conference call with reporters on Tuesday.
The cheapest vehicle Rivian currently sells, the R1T pickup, starts around $70,000, a price that has limited its sales to affluent early adopters. Its R1S S.U.V. starts at $75,000. Even at those prices, Rivian lost $39,000 for every vehicle it sold in the first three months of the year.
Rivian’s stock jumped more than 50 percent in extended trading on Tuesday after the deal was announced.
The electric vehicle market has been divided between relatively young companies like Tesla and Rivian, which make only battery-powered cars, and established carmakers like Volkswagen, General Motors and Toyota, which have often struggled to master the new technology.
Except for Tesla, none of newer U.S. carmakers specializing in electric vehicles have won significant market share. Some, like Fisker and Lordstown Motors, have ceased production and filed for bankruptcy protection.
Auto analysts have long considered Rivian among the electric vehicle start-ups most likely to survive, in part because it has raised billions of dollars in investment. Amazon is one of its largest shareholders and the main customer for the company’s delivery vans.
But Volkswagen and Rivian operate very differently, and it could be a challenge for them to work together. Volkswagen, which is based in Wolfsburg, Germany, is known for rigid, top-down management and is owned in part by the state of Lower Saxony. Rivian, based in Irvine, Calif., has the more freewheeling culture of a technology start-up. Rivian said in April that it expected to sell 57,000 vehicles this year, far fewer than Volkswagen sells in a week.
Mr. Scaringe and Oliver Blume, the chief executive of Volkswagen, said the deal blossomed after the two met at a Porsche customer center and bonded over their love of cars.
“We have a very similar mind-set,” Mr. Blume said during the conference call.
Ford Motor was for a time a big shareholder in Rivian, and the two companies once said they would build S.U.V.s together. But that plan never came to fruition, and Ford sold most of its Rivian shares. Ford and Volkswagen have a separate partnership that includes joint development and production of electric vehicles.
The Volkswagen-Rivian alliance could encourage other established carmakers to consider investments or partnerships connecting them with start-ups like Lucid Motors — companies that have well-regarded technology but are unprofitable and struggling to establish themselves in a crowded market. Another large automaker, Stellantis, the parent company of Chrysler, Fiat and Peugeot, has invested in a Chinese company, Leapmotor, for access to its electric car technology.
Vehicles using the software developed by the new joint venture will go on sale during the second half of the decade, Volkswagen said. Any of Volkswagen’s brands, which include Audi and Porsche, could use the technology, Mr. Blume said. Scout, the American off-road brand that Volkswagen is reviving at a factory under construction in South Carolina, could also use the software.
But Volkswagen and Rivian will continue to market their vehicles separately.

The North-East of India is a melting pot of a variegated cultural mosaic of people and races, an ethnic tapestry of many hues and shades. Yet, these states are lesser explored compared to the rest of the country. The new generation of travelers who are "money rich and time poor" are increasingly looking for unique experiences – a phenomenon called the emergence of the "experience economy." For this new and growing breed of tourists, the Northeast with its variety and uniqueness holds immense attraction.

A study conducted in 2020 by Dr. Sherap Bhutia revealed that the foreign tourist arrival in the Northeast increased from 37,380 persons in 2005 to 118,552 in 2014. The overall growth rate of tourists (both domestic and foreign) in the Northeast was as high as 26.44% during 2005-06. A high and positive growth of 12.53% was registered in foreign tourist visits to the North-East States of India during 2012 from 2011, which further rose to register a growth of 27.93% in 2013 from 2012.

Foreign tourist arrivals in the Northeast witnessed a growth of 39.77% in 2014 from 2013, according to data provided by the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India. The study recommendations for tourism planners included the need to concentrate on some key areas like enhancement of tourist facilities, tourism financing, focus on community involvement, and others for the formulation of a sustainable tourism strategy in the North-East States of India.

From paragraph 1, we can infer that the ________ and _______________ of the north-eastern states aid in attracting the 'money rich and time poor' tourists.
distinctiveness
conventionality
diversity
uniformity
modernity

```markdown
# [moby/libnetwork at master · moby/moby (github.com)](https://github.com/moby/moby/tree/master/libnetwork)

Libnetwork provides a native Go implementation for connecting containers

The goal of libnetwork is to deliver a robust Container Network Model that provides a consistent programming interface and the required network abstractions for applications.

#### Design
Please refer to the [design](docs/design.md) for more information.

#### Using libnetwork

There are many networking solutions available to suit a broad range of use-cases. libnetwork uses a driver / plugin model to support all of these solutions while abstracting the complexity of the driver implementations by exposing a simple and consistent Network Model to users.

## Contributing

Want to hack on libnetwork? [Docker's contributions guidelines](https://github.com/docker/docker/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) apply.

## Copyright and license
Code and documentation copyright 2015 Docker, inc. Code released under the Apache 2.0 license. Docs released under Creative commons.
```

Please condense your wholistic answers on the topic into a most technically-descriptive non-reductive wording-efficient single-sentence. Based on aforementioned sources, please verify and improve the following statement for accuracy and clarity based on the sources provided, in most non-reductive, concise, and informative way in under 255 characters:

libnetwork is a container networking library that provides a consistent interface connecting containers based on its networking drivers/plugins.

class Solution {
    public long maximumPoints(int[] enemyEnergies, int currentEnergy) {
        
    }
}
You are given an integer array enemyEnergies denoting the energy values of various enemies.

You are also given an integer currentEnergy denoting the amount of energy you have initially.

You start with 0 points, and all the enemies are unmarked initially.

You can perform either of the following operations zero or multiple times to gain points:

Choose an unmarked enemy, i, such that currentEnergy >= enemyEnergies[i]. By choosing this option:
You gain 1 point.
Your energy is reduced by the enemy's energy, i.e. currentEnergy = currentEnergy - enemyEnergies[i].
If you have at least 1 point, you can choose an unmarked enemy, i. By choosing this option:
Your energy increases by the enemy's energy, i.e. currentEnergy = currentEnergy + enemyEnergies[i].
The enemy i is marked.
Return an integer denoting the maximum points you can get in the end by optimally performing operations.

 

Example 1:

Input: enemyEnergies = [3,2,2], currentEnergy = 2

Output: 3

Explanation:

The following operations can be performed to get 3 points, which is the maximum:

First operation on enemy 1: points increases by 1, and currentEnergy decreases by 2. So, points = 1, and currentEnergy = 0.
Second operation on enemy 0: currentEnergy increases by 3, and enemy 0 is marked. So, points = 1, currentEnergy = 3, and marked enemies = [0].
First operation on enemy 2: points increases by 1, and currentEnergy decreases by 2. So, points = 2, currentEnergy = 1, and marked enemies = [0].
Second operation on enemy 2: currentEnergy increases by 2, and enemy 2 is marked. So, points = 2, currentEnergy = 3, and marked enemies = [0, 2].
First operation on enemy 1: points increases by 1, and currentEnergy decreases by 2. So, points = 3, currentEnergy = 1, and marked enemies = [0, 2].
Example 2:

Input: enemyEnergies = [2], currentEnergy = 10

Output: 5

Explanation:

Performing the first operation 5 times on enemy 0 results in the maximum number of points.

 

Constraints:

1 <= enemyEnergies.length <= 105
1 <= enemyEnergies[i] <= 109
0 <= currentEnergy <= 109

def divide_polynomials(numerator, denominator):
    quotient = []
    while len(numerator) >= len(denominator):
        lead_coeff = numerator[-1] / denominator[-1]
        quotient = [lead_coeff] + quotient
        for i in range(len(denominator)):
            numerator[-1 - i] -= lead_coeff * denominator[-1 - i]
        numerator.pop()
    return quotient

children.name: Programming and Code Refactoring
children.example1:
```
import os
import shutil
from pathlib import Path
from PIL import Image


# Variables
GRID_LAYOUT = "SpaceInvader"
IMG_SIZE = 512
SOURCE_FOLDER = "src_images"
JOB_NAME = "grumpy"


final_grid_image = JOB_NAME + "_grid.jpg"

# Folders
out_path = "output"
working_image_folder = os.path.join(out_path, JOB_NAME)

if not os.path.exists(working_image_folder):
    os.makedirs(working_image_folder)

# Define space invader grid
def invader():
    space_invader_rows = [
        [],
        [17, 23],
        [31, 32, 33, 34, 35],
        [43, 45, 46, 47, 49],
        [55, 56, 57, 58, 59, 60, 61, 62, 63],
        [67, 68, 69, 70, 71, 72, 73, 74, 75, 76, 77],
        [80, 82, 83, 84, 86, 87, 88, 90],
        [93, 95, 101, 103],
        [109, 110, 112, 113],
        []
    ]

    # Generate a list of all tile numbers and find background tiles
    all_tiles = [f"{i:03d}" for i in range(1, 131)]
    space_invader_tiles = [f"{tile:03d}" for row in space_invader_rows for tile in row]
    background_tiles = list(set(all_tiles) - set(space_invader_tiles))

    # Create blank images for background tiles
    for tile in background_tiles:
        img = Image.new(mode="RGB", size=(IMG_SIZE, IMG_SIZE))
        img.save(os.path.join(working_image_folder, f"{tile}.png"))

    # Get a list of image files from the source folder
    image_extensions = ['.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png']
    src_image_list = [f for f in os.listdir(SOURCE_FOLDER) 
                      if os.path.isfile(os.path.join(SOURCE_FOLDER, f)) 
                      and Path(f).suffix.lower() in image_extensions]

    # Check if there are enough images before proceeding
    if len(src_image_list) >= len(space_invader_tiles):
        # Copy and rename images according to the space invader pattern
        for i, tile in enumerate(space_invader_tiles, start=17):
            if i-17 < len(src_image_list):  # Ensure we don't run out of images
                src_file = os.path.join(SOURCE_FOLDER, src_image_list[i-17])
                dest_file = os.path.join(working_image_folder, f"{tile}.png")
                shutil.copy2(src_file, dest_file)  # copy2 preserves file metadata
    else:
        print(f"Not enough images in {SOURCE_FOLDER} to fill the Space Invader pattern.")



def create_grid(working_image_folder, final_grid_image, cols=13):
    """
    Creates a collage from images in a folder.

    Args:
        working_image_folder (str): Path to the folder containing images.
        final_grid_image (str): Path to save the output collage image.
        cols (int): Number of columns in the collage grid.
    """

    # Get all image files in the folder
    image_files = [f for f in os.listdir(working_image_folder) if os.path.isfile(os.path.join(working_image_folder, f))]

    # Determine rows needed based on number of images and columns
    total_images = len(image_files)
    rows = -(-total_images // cols)  # Ceiling division to get enough rows

    # Calculate thumbnail size to fit within desired columns
    thumbnail_width = 512   
    thumbnail_height = 512   

    # Create a new image with calculated dimensions
    collage_width = thumbnail_width * cols
    collage_height = thumbnail_height * rows
    collage = Image.new('RGB', (collage_width, collage_height))

    # Paste images onto the collage grid
    i = 0
    x_offset = 0
    y_offset = 0
    for image_file in image_files:
        try:
            # Open, resize, and paste each image
            img = Image.open(os.path.join(working_image_folder, image_file))
            img.thumbnail((thumbnail_width, thumbnail_height))
            collage.paste(img, (x_offset, y_offset))

            # Update position for the next image
            x_offset += thumbnail_width
            i += 1
            if i % cols == 0:
                # Move to the next row
                y_offset += thumbnail_height
                x_offset = 0

        except IOError:
            print(f"Unable to open image: {image_file}")

    # Save the collage
    collage.save(final_grid_image)
    print(f"Collage saved to: {final_grid_image}")



# Call the invader function to make the source images
invader()

# create the final image
create_grid(working_image_folder, final_grid_image)

```

suggest github repo name for this project

 is a Python library designed to simplify the synchronization of data across different sources. Whether you're dealing with databases, files, or APIs, it provides the tools you need to keep your data in sync.

Features
Easy Setup: Get started with minimal configuration.
Flexible: Support for various data sources including SQL databases, NoSQL databases, files, and web APIs.
Efficient: Optimized for performance to handle large volumes of data.
Customizable: Extend and customize the synchronization process according to your needs.
Conflict Resolution: Built-in strategies for handling data conflicts.
Installation
You can install it via pip:


pip install <NAME>
Quick Start
Here's a simple example to get you started with <NAME>:


from <NAME> import SyncManager
from <NAME>.sources import SQLSource, FileSource

# Define your data sources
source_db = SQLSource(connection_string='sqlite:///source.db', table='source_table')
target_file = FileSource(file_path='target.json')

# Create a SyncManager
sync_manager = SyncManager(source=source_db, target=target_file)

# Run the synchronization
sync_manager.sync()
Documentation
Full documentation can be found at https://<NAME>.readthedocs.io.

Contributing
Contributions are welcome! Please read the CONTRIBUTING.md file for guidelines on how to contribute to this project.

License
This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.

Acknowledgements
Special thanks to all the contributors and the open-source community for their support.

from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QMainWindow, QVBoxLayout, QWidget, QPushButton, QTextEdit
from PyQt5.QtCore import QTimer
import pyqtgraph as pg
import serial  # 导入pyserial库
from datetime import datetime


# 自定义时间轴
class TimeAxisItem(pg.AxisItem):
    def tickStrings(self, values, scale, spacing):
        return [datetime.fromtimestamp(value).strftime('%H:%M:%S') for value in values]


class DataDisplayWindow(QMainWindow):
    def __init__(self, serial_port):
        super().__init__()
        self.setWindowTitle("5G Module Data Display with Real-Time Axis")

        self.serial_port = serial_port  # 串口对象

        layout = QVBoxLayout()

        self.graphWidget = pg.PlotWidget(axisItems={'bottom': TimeAxisItem(orientation='bottom')})
        layout.addWidget(self.graphWidget)

        self.x = []  # 时间序列
        self.y1, self.y2, self.y3, self.y4 = [], [], [], []  # 各项数据序列
        self.lines = []
        self.colors = ['g', 'r', 'b', 'y']
        for _ in range(4):  # 初始化四条曲线
            line = self.graphWidget.plot([], [], pen=self.colors.pop(0))
            self.lines.append(line)

        self.status_text = QTextEdit()
        self.status_text.setReadOnly(True)
        layout.addWidget(self.status_text)

        central_widget = QWidget()
        central_widget.setLayout(layout)
        self.setCentralWidget(central_widget)

        # 定时器
        self.timer = QTimer()
        self.timer.setInterval(1000)  # 设置定时器每秒触发一次
        self.timer.timeout.connect(self.update_data)
        self.timer.start()

    def update_data(self):
        # 从串口读取数据
        if self.serial_port.inWaiting() > 0:
            serial_data = self.serial_port.readline().decode('utf-8').strip()
            data = serial_data.split(',')  # 假设数据格式为逗号分隔

            try:
                timestamp = float(data[0])
                dissolvedOxygen = float(data[1])
                temperature = float(data[2])
                ambientTemperature = float(data[3])
                waterTemperature = float(data[4])

                self.x.append(timestamp)
                self.y1.append(dissolvedOxygen)
                self.y2.append(temperature)
                self.y3.append(ambientTemperature)
                self.y4.append(waterTemperature)

                for idx, line in enumerate(self.lines):
                    line.setData(self.x, [self.y1, self.y2, self.y3, self.y4][idx])
            except ValueError:
                # 数据格式错误处理
                print("Data format error.")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app = QApplication(sys.argv)

    # 创建串口对象，填入你的串口参数
    serial_port = serial.Serial('COMx', baudrate=9600, timeout=1)

    main = DataDisplayWindow(serial_port)
    main.show()
    sys.exit(app.exec_()) 你这边可以接收图片吗

写一个开局库类，将开局最常见的几步写入类，程序引入这个类，将开局类单独写一个文件，然后再多添加一些开局和后续走法。电脑在开局直接使用开局库类中的走法，减少开局计算等待时间。

```
import tkinter as tk
import tkinter.messagebox as msgbox
import random
from collections import OrderedDict
import time
import threading

class Gomoku:
    def __init__(self):
        self.window = tk.Tk()
        self.window.title("五子棋")

        self.board_size = 15
        self.grid_size = 30
        # 棋盘数据
        self.board = [[0 for _ in range(self.board_size)] for _ in range(self.board_size)]
        # 当前玩家 1:黑棋 2:白棋
        self.current_player = 1
        # 用于存储最后一步棋子的标记
        self.last_move_marker = None
        # 游戏结束标志
        self.game_over = False
        # 存储已经计算过的状态，使用LRU缓存
        self.transposition_table = OrderedDict()
        self.max_cache_size = 100000

        self.waiting_label = tk.Label(self.window, text="电脑正在思考...", fg="blue")
        self.waiting_label.pack_forget()

        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self.window, width=self.board_size * self.grid_size,
                                height=self.board_size * self.grid_size, bg="burlywood")
        self.canvas.pack()

        self.draw_board()

        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.handle_click)

        self.restart_button = tk.Button(self.window, text="重新开始", command=self.restart_game)
        self.restart_button.pack()

        self.start_new_game()
        # 添加一个标志位，用于指示程序是否正在退出
        self.exiting = False
        self.window.protocol("WM_DELETE_WINDOW", self.on_closing) 
        self.window.mainloop()

    def start_new_game(self):
        self.board = [[0 for _ in range(self.board_size)] for _ in range(self.board_size)]
        self.game_over = False
        self.canvas.delete("piece")
        self.canvas.delete(self.last_move_marker)
        # 随机决定谁先走
        self.computer_first = random.choice([True, False])
        
        if self.computer_first:
            self.computer_color = 1  # 黑棋
            self.player_color = 2    # 白棋
            self.current_player = 1
            # 电脑固定走 7, 7 位置
            self.place_piece(7, 7)
            self.current_player = 2
            msgbox.showinfo("游戏开始", "电脑先手（黑棋），请您落子（白棋）")
        else:
            self.computer_color = 2  # 白棋
            self.player_color = 1    # 黑棋
            self.current_player = 1
            msgbox.showinfo("游戏开始", "您先手（黑棋），请落子")

    def draw_board(self):
        """绘制棋盘"""
        for i in range(self.board_size):
            self.canvas.create_line(self.grid_size / 2, self.grid_size / 2 + i * self.grid_size,
                                    self.grid_size / 2 + (self.board_size - 1) * self.grid_size,
                                    self.grid_size / 2 + i * self.grid_size)
            self.canvas.create_line(self.grid_size / 2 + i * self.grid_size, self.grid_size / 2,
                                    self.grid_size / 2 + i * self.grid_size,
                                    self.grid_size / 2 + (self.board_size - 1) * self.grid_size)

    def handle_click(self, event):
        if self.game_over or self.current_player != self.player_color:
            return

        row = round((event.y - self.grid_size / 2) / self.grid_size)
        col = round((event.x - self.grid_size / 2) / self.grid_size)

        if 0 <= row < self.board_size and 0 <= col < self.board_size and self.board[row][col] == 0:
            self.place_piece(row, col)

            if self.check_game_over(row, col):
                self.game_over = True
                winner = "黑棋" if self.player_color == 1 else "白棋"
                msgbox.showinfo("游戏结束", f"{winner}获胜！")
                return

            self.current_player = self.computer_color
            self.window.after(100, self.computer_move)

    def place_piece(self, row, col):
        self.board[row][col] = self.current_player

        x = self.grid_size / 2 + col * self.grid_size
        y = self.grid_size / 2 + row * self.grid_size
        color = "black" if self.current_player == 1 else "white"
        self.canvas.create_oval(x - self.grid_size / 2 + 3, y - self.grid_size / 2 + 3,
                                x + self.grid_size / 2 - 3, y + self.grid_size / 2 - 3,
                                fill=color, tags="piece")

        # 删除之前的标记
        if self.last_move_marker:
            self.canvas.delete(self.last_move_marker)

        # 创建新的圆形标记
        radius = 5  # 圆形的半径
        x1 = x - radius
        y1 = y - radius
        x2 = x + radius
        y2 = y + radius
        self.last_move_marker = self.canvas.create_oval(x1, y1, x2, y2, 
                                                        outline="red", width=2)

    def switch_player(self):
        self.current_player = 3 - self.current_player

    def check_game_over(self, row, col):
        player = self.board[row][col]
        for dir in [(1, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1), (1, -1)]:
            count = 1
            for i in range(1, 5):
                r = row + dir[0] * i
                c = col + dir[1] * i
                if 0 <= r < self.board_size and 0 <= c < self.board_size and self.board[r][c] == player:
                    count += 1
                else:
                    break
            for i in range(1, 5):
                r = row - dir[0] * i
                c = col - dir[1] * i
                if 0 <= r < self.board_size and 0 <= c < self.board_size and self.board[r][c] == player:
                    count += 1
                else:
                    break
            if count >= 5:
                return True
        return False

    def check_urgent_defense(self):
        for row in range(self.board_size):
            for col in range(self.board_size):
                if self.board[row][col] == 0:
                    # 检查对手连五
                    self.board[row][col] = 1
                    if self.check_game_over(row, col):
                        self.board[row][col] = 0
                        return row, col

                    # 检查对手活四
                    for dir in [(1, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1), (1, -1)]:
                        line = self.get_line(row, col, dir)
                        if [0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0] in [line[i:i + 6] for i in range(4)]:
                            self.board[row][col] = 0
                            return row, col

                    self.board[row][col] = 0
        return None

    def computer_move(self):
        print("Computer is making a move...")  # 调试信息
        if self.game_over:
            return

        self.waiting_label.pack()
        self.window.update()
        # 在启动线程之前检查程序是否正在退出
        if self.exiting:
            return
        # 使用多线程进行 AI 计算
        self.computer_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.computer_move_thread)
        self.computer_thread.start()

    def computer_move_thread(self):
        urgent_move = self.check_urgent_defense()
        if urgent_move:
            row, col = urgent_move
        else:
            best_move = self.iterative_deepening_search()
            if best_move:
                row, col = best_move
            else:
                print("No valid moves found!")  # 调试信息
                return

        print(f"Computer chose move: ({row}, {col})")  # 调试信息

        # 使用 after 方法更新 UI
        self.window.after(0, self.update_ui_after_move, row, col)

    def update_ui_after_move(self, row, col):
        self.place_piece(row, col)

        if self.check_game_over(row, col):
            self.game_over = True
            winner = "黑棋" if self.computer_color == 1 else "白棋"
            msgbox.showinfo("游戏结束", f"{winner}获胜！")
        else:
            self.current_player = self.player_color

        self.waiting_label.pack_forget()

    def restart_game(self):
        self.start_new_game()

    def iterative_deepening_search(self, max_time=0.5):
        start_time = time.time()
        depth = 1
        best_move = None
        
        while time.time() - start_time < max_time:
            move = self.search_at_depth(depth)
            if move:
                best_move = move
            depth += 1
        
        return best_move

    def search_at_depth(self, depth):
        best_score = -float('inf')
        best_move = None
        alpha = -float('inf')
        beta = float('inf')

        for move in self.get_valid_moves():
            row, col = move
            self.board[row][col] = 2
            board_hash = self.hash_board()
            score = self.minimax(depth - 1, False, alpha, beta, board_hash)
            self.board[row][col] = 0

            if score > best_score:
                best_score = score
                best_move = move

            alpha = max(alpha, best_score)
            if beta <= alpha:
                break

        return best_move

    def minimax(self, depth, is_maximizing, alpha, beta, board_hash):
        """Minimax 算法实现，使用置换表"""
        if board_hash in self.transposition_table:
            score, depth_stored = self.transposition_table[board_hash]
            # 如果存储的深度大于等于当前深度，直接返回分数
            if depth_stored >= depth:
                return score

        if depth == 0 or self.is_terminal():
            score = self.evaluate()
            # 将新的状态和分数存储到置换表中
            self.transposition_table[board_hash] = (score, depth)
            # 使用LRU缓存
            if len(self.transposition_table) > self.max_cache_size:
                self.transposition_table.popitem(last=False)
            return score

        if is_maximizing:
            best_score = -float('inf')
            for move in self.get_valid_moves():
                row, col = move
                self.board[row][col] = 2
                new_hash = self.hash_board()
                score = self.minimax(depth - 1, False, alpha, beta, new_hash)
                self.board[row][col] = 0
                best_score = max(score, best_score)
                alpha = max(alpha, best_score)
                if beta <= alpha:
                    break
            # 将新的状态和分数存储到置换表中
            self.transposition_table[board_hash] = (best_score, depth)
            # 使用LRU缓存
            if len(self.transposition_table) > self.max_cache_size:
                self.transposition_table.popitem(last=False)
            return best_score
        else:
            best_score = float('inf')
            for move in self.get_valid_moves():
                row, col = move
                self.board[row][col] = 1
                new_hash = self.hash_board()
                score = self.minimax(depth - 1, True, alpha, beta, new_hash)
                self.board[row][col] = 0
                best_score = min(score, best_score)
                beta = min(beta, best_score)
                if beta <= alpha:
                    break
            # 将新的状态和分数存储到置换表中
            self.transposition_table[board_hash] = (best_score, depth)
            # 使用LRU缓存
            if len(self.transposition_table) > self.max_cache_size:
                self.transposition_table.popitem(last=False)
            return best_score

    def get_valid_moves(self):
        """获取有效的落子位置，优先考虑已经有棋子的周围，并根据距离排序"""
        moves = []
        for row in range(self.board_size):
            for col in range(self.board_size):
                if self.board[row][col] == 0:
                    # 计算距离中心的距离，并根据距离排序，距离越近，优先级越高
                    distance = abs(row - self.board_size // 2) + abs(col - self.board_size // 2)
                    moves.append((distance, (row, col)))
        moves.sort(key=lambda x: x[0])
        return [move[1] for move in moves]  # 只返回坐标

    def has_neighbor(self, row, col):
        """检查周围是否有棋子"""
        for i in range(max(0, row - 2), min(self.board_size, row + 3)):
            for j in range(max(0, col - 2), min(self.board_size, col + 3)):
                if self.board[i][j] != 0:
                    return True
        return False

    def is_terminal(self):
        """检查是否达到终止状态"""
        for row in range(self.board_size):
            for col in range(self.board_size):
                if self.board[row][col] != 0 and self.check_game_over(row, col):
                    return True
        return len(self.get_valid_moves()) == 0

    def evaluate(self):
        score = 0
        for row in range(self.board_size):
            for col in range(self.board_size):
                if self.board[row][col] != 0:
                    score += self.evaluate_point(row, col)
        return score

    def evaluate_point(self, row, col):
        piece = self.board[row][col]
        score = 0
        
        # 位置权重
        center = self.board_size // 2
        distance_from_center = max(abs(row - center), abs(col - center))
        position_weight = 1 - (distance_from_center / center)
        score += position_weight * 10

        # 检查四个方向
        directions = [(1, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1), (1, -1)]
        for dr, dc in directions:
            line = self.get_line(row, col, (dr, dc))
            score += self.evaluate_line(line, piece)

        return score if piece == 2 else -score

    def evaluate_line(self, line, piece):
        score = 0
        opponent = 3 - piece
        
        # 连五
        if [piece] * 5 in [line[i:i+5] for i in range(5)]:
            score += 1000000
        
        # 活四
        if [0, piece, piece, piece, piece, 0] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)]:
            score += 50000
        
        # 冲四
        if [opponent, piece, piece, piece, piece, 0] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)] or \
           [0, piece, piece, piece, piece, opponent] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)]:
            score += 10000
        
        # 活三
        if [0, piece, piece, piece, 0] in [line[i:i+5] for i in range(5)]:
            score += 5000
        
        # 眠三
        if [opponent, piece, piece, piece, 0, 0] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)] or \
           [0, 0, piece, piece, piece, opponent] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)]:
            score += 1000
        
        # 活二
        if [0, 0, piece, piece, 0, 0] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)]:
            score += 500
        
        # 眠二
        if [opponent, 0, piece, piece, 0, 0] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)] or \
           [0, 0, piece, piece, 0, opponent] in [line[i:i+6] for i in range(4)]:
            score += 100
        
        return score

    def get_line(self, row, col, direction):
        """获取指定方向的线"""
        line = []
        for i in range(-5, 6):  # 扩展范围以检测更多棋型
            r = row + i * direction[0]
            c = col + i * direction[1]
            if 0 <= r < self.board_size and 0 <= c < self.board_size:
                line.append(self.board[r][c])
            else:
                line.append(-1)  # 超出边界用 -1 表示
        return line

    def hash_board(self):
        """将棋盘状态转换为哈希值"""
        return hash(str(self.board))

    def on_closing(self):
        """处理窗口关闭事件"""
        print(f"退出线程。")  # 调试信息
        self.exiting = True  # 设置退出标志位
        # 等待 AI 计算线程结束
        if hasattr(self, 'computer_thread') and self.computer_thread.is_alive():
            self.computer_thread.join()
        self.window.destroy()

# 启动游戏
if __name__ == "__main__":
    game = Gomoku()
    game.window.mainloop()
``` 利用棋盘镜像，演化出更多的开局。
children.example4:
import json
import re

from nicegui import ui

# 全局定义 elements_to_clear 列表
elements_to_clear = []

# 从 JSON 文件读取药材数据
with open('herbs.json', 'r', encoding="utf-8") as f:
    herbs_data = json.load(f)
    herbs = [item['name'] for item in herbs_data]

# 从另一个 json 文件读取已知药方
with open('prescriptions.json', 'r', encoding="utf-8") as f:
    known_prescriptions = json.load(f)

# 从 herb_mappings.json 文件读取别名字典
with open('herb_mappings.json', 'r', encoding="utf-8") as f:
    herb_mappings = json.load(f)
    # 创建一个标准名称到别名的反向字典
    standard_to_aliases = {}
    for alias, standard in herb_mappings.items():
        if standard not in standard_to_aliases:
            standard_to_aliases[standard] = []
        standard_to_aliases[standard].append(alias)

ui.label('请选择药材：')
selected_herbs = []

# 存储 checkbox 组件的字典
checkbox_components = {}

# 用于记录已勾选药材的数量
selected_count = 0

# 使用 grid 布局，每行显示 10 列药材
with ui.grid(columns=10):
    def create_checkbox(herb):
        with ui.checkbox(herb) as checkbox:
            checkbox.value = False
            @checkbox.on_value_change
            def on_change(checkbox):
                global selected_count
                if checkbox.value:
                    if herb not in selected_herbs:
                        selected_herbs.append(herb)
                        selected_count += 1
                        update_search_box(herb, True)
                else:
                    if herb in selected_herbs:
                        selected_herbs.remove(herb)
                        selected_count -= 1
                        update_search_box(herb, False)
                # 实时更新显示已勾选药材的数量
                selected_count_label.text = f'已选药材: {selected_count} 味'
            checkbox_components[herb] = checkbox  # 将 checkbox 组件保存到字典

    for herb in herbs:
        create_checkbox(herb)

# 新增下拉列表，并增加"取消选择"选项
prescription_dropdown = ui.select(options=['取消选择'] + [prescription["药方"] for prescription in known_prescriptions], label="选择已有药方").style('width: 300px; font-size: 16px;')

@prescription_dropdown.on_value_change
def on_prescription_dropdown_change():
    selected_prescription = prescription_dropdown.value
    if selected_prescription == '取消选择':
        clear_checkboxes()
    else:
        for prescription in known_prescriptions:
            if prescription["药方"] == selected_prescription:
                clear_checkboxes()
                prescription_items = {k: v for k, v in prescription.items() if k != "药方"}
                for herb in prescription_items:
                    checkbox_components[herb].value = True

# 文本框用于用户输入药材
search_box = ui.input(label='请输入药材名称，并在每一味药材后面输入空格，包括最后一味药。').style('width: 1200px; font-size: 16px;')

@search_box.on_value_change
def on_search_change():
    input_text = search_box.value.split()
    for herb in herbs:
        # Check if the herb or any of its aliases are in the input text
        if herb in input_text or any(alias in input_text for alias in standard_to_aliases.get(herb, [])):
            if not checkbox_components[herb].value:
                checkbox_components[herb].value = True
        elif herb not in input_text and all(alias not in input_text for alias in standard_to_aliases.get(herb, [])):
            if checkbox_components[herb].value:
                checkbox_components[herb].value = False

def update_search_box(herb, is_selected):
    # 获取该药材的所有别名
    aliases = standard_to_aliases.get(herb, [])
    if is_selected:
        if herb not in search_box.value.split():
            search_box.value += herb + " "
    else:
        # 使用正则表达式匹配整个单词
        pattern = r'\b({})\b'.format('|'.join(map(re.escape, [herb] + aliases)))
        search_box.value = re.sub(pattern, '', search_box.value).strip()
        # 重新计算输入框中的药材列表，以防止重复或遗漏
        current_herbs = search_box.value.split()
        search_box.value = " ".join(current_herbs) + " "

def clear_checkboxes():
    clear_results()
    for herb, checkbox in checkbox_components.items():  # 遍历字典
        checkbox.value = False  # 清除勾选状态
    selected_herbs.clear()  # 清空已选择的药材列表
    global selected_count
    selected_count = 0
    selected_count_label.text = f'已选药材共计: {selected_count} 味'
    search_box.value = ""
    prescription_dropdown.value = ""

def find_combinations():
    clear_results()
    found_combinations = []
    for known_prescription in known_prescriptions:
        prescription_items = {k: v for k, v in known_prescription.items() if k != "药方"}  # 排除名称
        is_subset = all(herb in selected_herbs for herb in prescription_items)
        if is_subset:
            found_combinations.append({
                "name": known_prescription["药方"],
                "combination": [(herb, known_prescription[herb]) for herb in prescription_items]
            })

    # 将新生成的元素添加到 elements_to_clear 列表
    selected_label = ui.label('您选择的药材：')
    elements_to_clear.append(selected_label)

    selected_herb_list = " ".join(selected_herbs)  # 将选择的药材名称连成一行
    selected_herb_content_label = ui.label(selected_herb_list)
    elements_to_clear.append(selected_herb_content_label)

    combination_label = ui.label('包含的药方组合：')
    elements_to_clear.append(combination_label)

    for combination in found_combinations:
        combination_str = " ".join([f'{herb}{amount}' for herb, amount in combination["combination"]])
        combination_content_label = ui.label(f'{combination["name"]}：{combination_str}')
        elements_to_clear.append(combination_content_label)

    # 将结果写入文件，包括已选药材数量
    with open('found_combinations.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
        f.write('您选择的药材：\n')
        f.write(selected_herb_list + '\n\n')  # 写入选择的药材名称在一行
        f.write('共计: {} 味\n\n'.format(selected_count))  # 写入已选药材数量
        f.write('包含的药方组合：\n')
        for combination in found_combinations:
            combination_str = " ".join([f'{herb}{amount}' for herb, amount in combination["combination"]])
            f.write(f'{combination["name"]}：{combination_str}\n')

# 清除按钮及对应的清除函数
def clear_results():
    while elements_to_clear:  # 只要列表不为空就一直删除
        element = elements_to_clear.pop()  # 弹出列表中的最后一个元素
        element.delete()  # 删除元素

# 显示已勾选药材数量的标签
selected_count_label = ui.label(f'已选药材共计: {selected_count} 味')

ui.button('提交', on_click=lambda: find_combinations())
ui.button('清除', on_click=clear_checkboxes)

ui.run()

-- Made By EggTargaryen, HeyBoxUID: 1310911, V1.3
local savedSet = {}
local changed = false
local selectedIndex = 1
local valIndex = 1
local firstLoad = true
local hasChanged = false
local firstOpenWin = true

local font = nil
local timer = 0
local timerMax = 1000

local inGameMsgCheckColor = 0xFF69F0AE
local inGameMsgErrColor = 0xFFFF5252
local inGameMsgCheckText = ""
local inGameMsgErrText = ""
local isEnough = true
local showLoadMsg = true
local showErrMsg = true

local config = {
  SelectedSetNo = "1",
  FirstLoad = true,
  ShowLoadMsg = true,
  ShowErrMsg = true
}
local configPath = "itemSetAutoResupply.json"

local function readConfig()
  if json ~= nil then
    local file = json.load_file(configPath)
    if file ~= nil then
      config = file
      selectedIndex = tonumber(config.SelectedSetNo)
      valIndex = tonumber(config.SelectedSetNo)
      firstLoad = config.FirstLoad
      showLoadMsg = config.ShowLoadMsg
      showErrMsg = config.ShowErrMsg
      print("Read Index = " .. tonumber(valIndex))
    else
      json.dump_file(configPath, config)
    end
  end
end

readConfig()

local function getItemMySetList()
  itemMySet = sdk.get_managed_singleton("snow.data.DataManager"):get_field("_ItemMySet")
  if not itemMySet then
    log.debug("[Error] Item My Set Read Error!")
  end
  return itemMySet:get_field("_MySetList")
end

local function setMySetByNo(mySetNo)
  mySetNo = mySetNo - 1
  itemMySet = sdk.get_managed_singleton("snow.data.DataManager"):get_field("_ItemMySet")
  if not itemMySet then
    log.debug("[Error] Item My Set Read Error!")
  end
  itemMySet:call("applyItemMySet", mySetNo)
  playerItemPounchMySetData = itemMySet:call("getData", mySetNo)
  isEnough = playerItemPounchMySetData:call("isEnoughItem")
  local setName = playerItemPounchMySetData:get_field("_Name")
  inGameMsgCheckText = "[INFO]Load Set: " .. tostring(mySetNo + 1) .. " - " .. setName
  if not isEnough then
    inGameMsgErrText = "[WARNING]Item Not Enough"
  else
    inGameMsgErrText = ""
  end
end

local function getQuestStatus()
  local questManager = sdk.get_managed_singleton("snow.QuestManager")
  if not questManager then
    return
  end
  return questManager:get_field("_QuestStatus")
end

local function getSavedSetList()
  local mySetList = getItemMySetList()
  local mySetLen = mySetList:call("get_Count")
  mySetList = mySetList:call("ToArray")
  local savedSetList = {}
  for index = 0, mySetLen - 1 do
    local playerItemPounchMySetData = mySetList[index]
    if not playerItemPounchMySetData then
      log.debug("[Error] Saved My Set No." .. index .. " Data Error!")
    else
      local mySetName = playerItemPounchMySetData:get_field("_Name")
      if playerItemPounchMySetData:call("isUsing") then
        -- print((index + 1) .. mySetName)
        savedSetList[index + 1] = tostring(index + 1) .. "-" .. mySetName
      end
    end
  end
  savedSet = savedSetList
end

-- getSavedSetList()

local function stringSplit(str, sp)
  local result = {}
  local i = 0
  local j = 0
  local num = 1
  local pos = 0
  while true do
    i, j = string.find(str, sp, i + 1)
    if i == nil then
      if num ~= 1 then
        result[num] = string.sub(str, pos, string.len(str))
      end
      break
    end
    result[num] = string.sub(str, pos, i - 1)
    pos = i + string.len(sp)
    num = num + 1
  end
  return result
end

re.on_application_entry("UpdateBehavior", function()
  if not firstLoad and not hasChanged and getQuestStatus() == 0 then
    print("auto resupply active - index = " .. tostring(valIndex))
    timer = 0
    setMySetByNo(valIndex)
    hasChanged = true
  end
  if getQuestStatus() ~= 0 then
    hasChanged = false
    timer = timerMax + 1
  end
  if timer <= timerMax then
    -- print(timer)
    timer = timer + 1
  end
end)

re.on_draw_ui(function()
  imgui.begin_window("Item Set Auto Resupply", ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)
  if imgui.button("Reload Item Set List") then
    getSavedSetList()
  end
  showLoadMsgChanged, showLoadMsg = imgui.checkbox("Show Auto Load Message in Game", showLoadMsg)
  if showLoadMsgChanged then
    config.ShowLoadMsg = showLoadMsg
    json.dump_file(configPath, config)
  end
  showErrMsgChanged, showErrMsg = imgui.checkbox("Show Auto Error Message in Game", showErrMsg)
  if showErrMsgChanged then
    config.ShowErrMsg = showErrMsg
    json.dump_file(configPath, config)
  end
  if not firstLoad and firstOpenWin then
    print("Read Item Set on First Login")
    getSavedSetList()
    firstOpenWin = false
  end
  changed, selectedIndex = imgui.combo("Saved Item Set Number", selectedIndex, savedSet)
  if changed then
    valIndex = tonumber(stringSplit(savedSet[selectedIndex], "-")[1])
    print("change active - index = " .. tostring(valIndex))
    setMySetByNo(valIndex)
    firstLoad = false
    config.SelectedSetNo = tostring(valIndex)
    config.FirstLoad = firstLoad
    json.dump_file(configPath, config)
    hasChanged = true
    timer = 0
    getSavedSetList()
  end
  if not firstLoad then
    imgui.text("Item Set Has Been Set To [ " .. savedSet[selectedIndex] .. " ]")
  end
  imgui.end_window()
end)

d2d.register(function()
  font = d2d.Font.new("Consolas", 24)
end,
  function()
    local screen_w, screen_h = d2d.surface_size()
    if timer <= timerMax and showLoadMsg then
      d2d.text(font, inGameMsgCheckText, 20, screen_h / 2, inGameMsgCheckColor)
    end
    if timer <= timerMax and showErrMsg then
      d2d.text(font, inGameMsgErrText, 20, screen_h / 2 + 25, inGameMsgErrColor)
    end
  end)

Generally, all of the popular JS frameworks and 'not frameworks' are "good" - i.e. you can produce roughly the same product with them, correct?
But the difference is that react is small, vue is even smaller, svelte is fast(where it doesn't matter), ember.js is effectively angular if you want to make your life harder but more customizeable.
Next/nuxt.js are essentially the same stuff, sveltekit is a full fledged framework(which you use if you want to make your life harder).

children.name: Code Optimization and Debugging
children.example1:
import numpy as np

def bindct_8x8(input_block):
    # Input: input_block is an 8x8 numpy array of integers
    # Output: output_block is an 8x8 numpy array of integers (DCT coefficients)
    
    output_block = np.zeros((8, 8), dtype=np.int32)
    
    for i in range(8):
        # Apply 1D binDCT to each row
        output_block[i] = lift_dct8(input_block[i])
    
    # Transpose the result
    output_block = output_block.T
    
    for i in range(8):
        # Apply 1D binDCT to each column (which are now rows after transpose)
        output_block[i] = lift_dct8(output_block[i])
    
    # Transpose back to get the final result
    return output_block.T


def lift_dct8(x):
    x = x.astype(np.int32)
    
    # Stage 1: Lifting
    x[1] += x[7]
    x[7] = x[0] - x[7]
    x[0] -= x[1] >> 1
    
    x[3] += x[5]
    x[5] = x[2] - x[5]
    x[2] -= x[3] >> 1
    
    x[0] += x[3]
    x[3] = x[1] - x[3]
    x[1] -= x[0] >> 1
    
    x[2] += x[5]
    x[5] = x[7] - x[5]
    x[7] -= x[2] >> 1
    
    # Stage 2: Rotation
    a = (x[0] + x[7]) * 4091
    b = (x[0] - x[7]) * 4091
    x[0] = (a + b) >> 13
    x[7] = (a - b) >> 13
    
    a = (x[1] + x[6]) * 3784
    b = (x[1] - x[6]) * 3784
    x[1] = (a + b) >> 13
    x[6] = (a - b) >> 13
    
    a = (x[2] + x[5]) * 3227
    b = (x[2] - x[5]) * 3227
    x[2] = (a + b) >> 13
    x[5] = (a - b) >> 13
    
    a = (x[3] + x[4]) * 2409
    b = (x[3] - x[4]) * 2409
    x[3] = (a + b) >> 13
    x[4] = (a - b) >> 13
    
    return x


def ibindct_8x8(input_block):
    # Input: input_block is an 8x8 numpy array of integers (DCT coefficients)
    # Output: output_block is an 8x8 numpy array of integers
    
    output_block = np.zeros((8, 8), dtype=np.int32)
    
    for i in range(8):
        # Apply 1D inverse binDCT to each row
        output_block[i] = ilift_dct8(input_block[i])
    
    # Transpose the result
    output_block = output_block.T
    
    for i in range(8):
        # Apply 1D inverse binDCT to each column (which are now rows after transpose)
        output_block[i] = ilift_dct8(output_block[i])
    
    # Transpose back to get the final result
    return output_block.T

def ilift_dct8(x):
    x = x.astype(np.int32)
    
    # Stage 2: Inverse Rotation
    a = (x[0] + x[7]) << 13
    b = (x[0] - x[7]) << 13
    x[0] = (a + b) // 8182
    x[7] = (a - b) // 8182
    
    a = (x[1] + x[6]) << 13
    b = (x[1] - x[6]) << 13
    x[1] = (a + b) // 7568
    x[6] = (a - b) // 7568
    
    a = (x[2] + x[5]) << 13
    b = (x[2] - x[5]) << 13
    x[2] = (a + b) // 6454
    x[5] = (a - b) // 6454
    
    a = (x[3] + x[4]) << 13
    b = (x[3] - x[4]) << 13
    x[3] = (a + b) // 4818
    x[4] = (a - b) // 4818
    
    # Stage 1: Inverse Lifting
    x[7] += x[2] >> 1
    x[5] = x[7] - x[5]
    x[2] -= x[5]
    
    x[1] += x[0] >> 1
    x[3] = x[1] - x[3]
    x[0] -= x[3]
    
    x[2] += x[3] >> 1
    x[5] = x[2] - x[5]
    x[3] -= x[5]
    
    x[0] += x[1] >> 1
    x[7] = x[0] - x[7]
    x[1] -= x[7]
    
    return x


def test_bindct():
    # Create a random 8x8 input block
    input_block = np.random.randint(0, 256, (8, 8), dtype=np.int32)
    
    print("Original input:")
    print(input_block)
    
    # Apply forward binDCT
    dct_coeffs = bindct_8x8(input_block)
    
    print("\nbinDCT coefficients:")
    print(dct_coeffs)
    
    # Apply inverse binDCT
    reconstructed = ibindct_8x8(dct_coeffs)
    
    print("\nReconstructed input:")
    print(reconstructed)
    
    # Check if the reconstruction is perfect
    if np.array_equal(input_block, reconstructed):
        print("\nPerfect reconstruction achieved!")
    else:
        print("\nReconstruction failed.")
        print("Difference:")
        print(input_block - reconstructed)
    
    # Calculate mean absolute error
    mae = np.mean(np.abs(input_block - reconstructed))
    print(f"\nMean Absolute Error: {mae}")

# Run the test
test_bindct()

children.example2:
Привет! Оптимизируй следующую программу на Python: import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def D(psi):
    
    N = 5
    q = 1.05
    
    A = 1
    for i in range(2, N + 1):
        z_i = q * (q**(i - 1) -1) / (q - 1)
        A = A + np.exp(1j * psi * z_i)    
    return abs(A / N)

X = []
Y = []

a = -6
b = 6
N = 1000

h = (b - a) / N

for i in range(0, N + 1):
    X.append(a + h * i)
    Y.append(D(a+ h * i))

plt.grid(color='purple', linestyle='--')
plt.plot(X, Y, 'r')
plt.show()

import os
import csv
import random
from tqdm import tqdm
import albumentations as A

# Define augmentations using Albumentations
augmentations = [
    ('Rotation', A.Rotate(limit=30, p=1.0)),
    # Randomly rotates the image by an angle within the range [-30, 30] degrees.
    # 'limit' sets the maximum absolute rotation angle.
    # 'p' is the probability of applying this augmentation (1.0 means always apply).

    ('Translation', A.Affine(translate_percent={"x": (-0.1, 0.1), "y": (-0.1, 0.1)}, p=1.0)),
    # Randomly translates the image horizontally and vertically.
    # 'translate_percent' specifies the range of translation as a percentage of the image size.
    # Here, it can move up to 10% in any direction along both x and y axes.

    ('FlipHorizontal', A.HorizontalFlip(p=1.0)),
    # Flips the image horizontally (left to right).
    # 'p' of 1.0 means it will always be applied when selected.

    ('FlipVertical', A.VerticalFlip(p=1.0)),
    # Flips the image vertically (top to bottom).
    # 'p' of 1.0 means it will always be applied when selected.

    ('Brightness', A.RandomBrightnessContrast(brightness_limit=0.2, contrast_limit=0, p=1.0)),
    # Randomly changes the brightness of the image.
    # 'brightness_limit' of 0.2 means it can change brightness by up to 20% (darker or brighter).
    # 'contrast_limit' is set to 0, so contrast remains unchanged.

    ('Contrast', A.RandomBrightnessContrast(brightness_limit=0, contrast_limit=0.2, p=1.0)),
    # Randomly changes the contrast of the image.
    # 'contrast_limit' of 0.2 means it can change contrast by up to 20% (decrease or increase).
    # 'brightness_limit' is set to 0, so brightness remains unchanged.

    ('Saturation', A.HueSaturationValue(hue_shift_limit=0, sat_shift_limit=(-0.2, 0.2), val_shift_limit=0, p=1.0)),
    # Randomly changes the saturation of the image.
    # 'sat_shift_limit' of (-0.2, 0.2) means it can change saturation by up to 20% in either direction.
    # Hue and value (brightness) remain unchanged.

    ('Hue', A.HueSaturationValue(hue_shift_limit=(-0.1, 0.1), sat_shift_limit=0, val_shift_limit=0, p=1.0)),
    # Randomly shifts the hue of the image.
    # 'hue_shift_limit' of (-0.1, 0.1) means it can shift the hue by up to 10% in either direction.
    # Saturation and value (brightness) remain unchanged.

    ('Sharpness', A.Sharpen(alpha=(0.2, 0.5), lightness=(0.5, 1.0), p=1.0)),
    # Randomly sharpens the image.
    # 'alpha' controls the intensity of sharpening, ranging from 20% to 50% here.
    # 'lightness' adjusts the lightness of the sharpened image, ranging from 50% to 100% here.

    ('Blur', A.GaussianBlur(blur_limit=(3, 7), p=1.0))
    # Applies random Gaussian blur to the image.
    # 'blur_limit' sets the range for the blur kernel size, here between 3x3 and 7x7 pixels.
]

def apply_augmentations(image, selected_augs):
    """
    Apply selected augmentations to the image and return the augmented image and details.
    """
    combined_aug = A.Compose([aug[1] for aug in selected_augs])
    augmented = combined_aug(image=image)
    aug_img = augmented['image']
    
    aug_details = []
    for aug_name, _ in selected_augs:
        if aug_name == 'Rotation':
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['angle']:.2f}")
        elif aug_name == 'Translation':
            translate = augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['translate_percent']
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={translate['x']:.2f},{translate['y']:.2f}")
        elif aug_name in ['FlipHorizontal', 'FlipVertical']:
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}=1")
        elif aug_name in ['Brightness', 'Contrast']:
            factor = augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['brightness'] if aug_name == 'Brightness' else augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['contrast']
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={factor:.2f}")
        elif aug_name == 'Saturation':
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['sat_shift']:.2f}")
        elif aug_name == 'Hue':
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['hue_shift']:.2f}")
        elif aug_name == 'Sharpness':
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['alpha']:.2f}")
        elif aug_name == 'Blur':
            aug_details.append(f"{aug_name}={augmented['replay']['transforms'][0]['params']['blur_limit']:.2f}")
    
    return aug_img, aug_details

def process_image(img_path, root, file, augmentation_factor, augmentation_limit):
    """
    Process a single image, apply augmentations, and return augmentation information.
    """
    aug_images_info = []
    for i in range(augmentation_factor):
        num_augs = min(random.randint(1, augmentation_limit), len(augmentations))
        selected_augs = random.sample(augmentations, num_augs)
        aug_name = '_'.join([aug[0] for aug in selected_augs])

        # Apply augmentations
        image = A.imread(img_path)
        aug_img, aug_details = apply_augmentations(image, selected_augs)

        # Save the augmented image
        aug_filename = f"aug_{os.path.splitext(file)[0]}_{aug_name}{os.path.splitext(file)[1]}"
        aug_path = os.path.join(root, aug_filename)
        A.imwrite(aug_path, aug_img)

        aug_images_info.append([aug_filename] + aug_details)
    
    return aug_images_info

def write_csv(base_dir, csv_data, augmentation_factor, augmentation_limit, seed):
    """
    Write augmentation data to a CSV file with parameters in the filename.
    """
    csv_filename = f'augmentation_summary_f{augmentation_factor}_l{augmentation_limit}_s{seed}.csv'
    csv_path = os.path.join(base_dir, csv_filename)
    
    with open(csv_path, 'w', newline='') as csvfile:
        writer = csv.writer(csvfile)
        header = [f'Augmentation Summary (Factor={augmentation_factor}, Limit={augmentation_limit}, Seed={seed})']
        writer.writerow(header)
        sub_header = ['Original Image', 'Number of Augmentations'] + [f'Augmented Image {i+1}' for i in range(augmentation_factor)]
        writer.writerow(sub_header)
        for row in csv_data:
            writer.writerow(row)
    
    return csv_path

def augment_images(base_dir, augmentation_factor=5, augmentation_limit=3):
    """
    Main function to augment images and generate a summary CSV.
    """
    csv_data = []
    for root, _, files in os.walk(base_dir):
        for file in tqdm(files, desc=f"Processing {os.path.basename(root)}"):
            if not file.startswith('aug_') and file.lower().endswith(image_extensions):
                img_path = os.path.join(root, file)
                aug_images_info = process_image(img_path, root, file, augmentation_factor, augmentation_limit)
                
                # Add information to csv_data
                relative_path = os.path.relpath(img_path, base_dir)
                csv_data.append([relative_path, len(aug_images_info)] + [item for sublist in aug_images_info for item in sublist])

    # Write to CSV with parameters in filename
    csv_path = write_csv(base_dir, csv_data, augmentation_factor, augmentation_limit, SEED)
    print(f"CSV file has been saved to {csv_path}")

# Usage
augment_images(aug_dir, augmentation_factor=5, augmentation_limit=3)

I'll first take a look at the content of your Python file.

The provided code appears to be a Python project that involves GUI elements, likely using the Tkinter library. The code seems to have functionalities related to PDF handling, OCR processing, and directory generation. To improve the code's structure, readability, and maintainability, and to transition the GUI to a web-based application, consider the following steps:

Code Optimization Suggestions
Refactor Code into Separate Modules:

Divide the code into separate modules based on functionality (e.g., pdf_handler.py, ocr_processor.py, gui.py).
Use a main script (e.g., main.py) to import and initialize these modules.
Use Classes and Methods:

Ensure each class has a single responsibility.
Encapsulate related functions into appropriate classes.
Exception Handling:

Replace generic except blocks with specific exceptions.
Provide informative error messages.
Code Comments and Documentation:

Add comments to explain the purpose of complex code sections.
Use docstrings for functions and classes.
Remove Hardcoded Values:

Replace hardcoded values with configuration files or constants.
Transition to a Web-Based Application
To transition your desktop application to a web-based application, consider using a web framework such as Flask or Django. Here's a high-level overview of how you can proceed:

Set Up a Web Framework:

Choose a web framework (Flask for simplicity or Django for a more feature-rich framework).
Convert GUI Logic:

Replace Tkinter GUI components with HTML templates.

children.example2:
import logging
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession
from sqlalchemy import select
from models import AsyncSessionLocal, User, init_db
from schemas import User as UserSchema, UserCreate

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

app = FastAPI()

async def get_db():
    async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session:
        yield session

@app.on_event("startup")
async def startup_event():
    await init_db()

@app.post("/users1/", response_model=UserSchema)
async def create_user(user: UserCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)):
    print("test")
    print(user)
    try:
        logger.debug(f"Attempting to create user: {user.model_dump()}")
        result = await db.execute(select(User).filter(User.username == user.username))
        db_user = result.scalar_one_or_none()
        if db_user:
            logger.warning(f"Username {user.username} already exists")
            raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Username already registered")
        new_user = User(username=user.username)
        db.add(new_user)
        await db.commit()
        await db.refresh(new_user)
        logger.info(f"User created successfully: {new_user.__dict__}")
        return {"Test": True}
    except Exception as e:
        print("мда")
        logger.exception(f"Error creating user: {str(e)}")
        await db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=f"Internal server error: {str(e)}")

@app.get("/users/{user_id}", response_model=UserSchema)
async def read_user(user_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)):
    try:
        result = await db.execute(select(User).filter(User.id == user_id))
        db_user = result.scalar_one_or_none()
        if db_user is None:
            raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="User not found")
        logger.debug(f"Retrieved user: {db_user.__dict__}")
        return UserSchema.model_validate(db_user.__dict__)
    except Exception as e:
        logger.exception(f"Error retrieving user: {str(e)}")
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=f"Internal server error: {str(e)}")

<?php

strtoupper($user_input);

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
